Detailed Description

ByteAllocator of fixed size objects with cache for fast allocation (thread unsafe)

A list registers freed blocks until a given theshold. Allocation tries to found a block in the list before using standard allocation. Deallocation puts a block in the list until list size is equal to threshold. At that time normal deallocation is done. We can define a new allocator of cells: 

    ByteAllocator A;

void Util::ByteAllocator::initialize ( const char *  name,
size_t  bloc_size,
size_t  item_size,
int  cache_count 
) [inline]

Initialize with a given threshold Construct a ByteAllocator which allows to cache at most cache_count bloc. A bloc is organized as a vector of item. The number of items is given by bbloc_size / item_size which should be an exact division.

Parameters:
bloc_size the number of bytes of a bloc.
item_size the number of bytes of an item.
cache_count the number of allocated bloc cached by the allocator
void Util::ByteAllocator::terminate (  ) 

Free all data in freelist
